contentrichtext.text: '''Mic''' or '''MIC''' may refer to: {{TOC right}} == Business and industry == * [[Military-industrial complex]], the relationship between a nation's military forces and its arms industry * [[Miami Intermodal Center]], a mega-transportation hub in Miami, Florida * [[Mortgage Investment Corporation]], a Canadian investment and lending company * [[Motorcycle Industry Council]], an American non-profit trade association * [[Market Identifier Code]], or ISO 10383, a standard which defines codes for stock market exchanges * [[Military Industry Corporation]], the main armament industry for the Sudanese military * [[Myanmar Investment Commission]] * [[Metal Improvement Company]], a company specializing in metal surface treatments == Education == * [[Mary Immaculate College]], a college in Limerick, Ireland * [[Metropolitan Interscholastic Conference]], a high school athletic conference in Indiana * [[Multan Institute of Cardiology]], Pakistan == Entertainment == *''[[Made in Chelsea]]'', English dramality show * [[M.I.C. (band)]] (or MIC男团), a Chinese boyband formed by Taihe Rye Music == Government and politics == * [[Malaysian Indian Congress]], a Malaysian political party * [[Ministry of Information and Communication (South Korea)]], a government agency == Medicine == * [[Minimum inhibitory concentration]] * [[Medical image computing]] == Religion == * [[Marians of the Immaculate Conception]], a Roman Catholic clerical congregation == Science == * [[Metal-induced crystallization]], a method for turning amorphous silicon into polycrystalline silicon * [[Metastable intermolecular composite]], a type of reactive material in explosives research * [[Methyl isocyanate]], a hazardous chemical compound used in pesticides * [[Microbial corrosion]], or Microbially-induced corrosion, corrosion caused or promoted by microorganisms * [[Microscopium]], a constellation * [[Microwave integrated circuit]] * [[Mi'kmaq language]]'s ISO 639 alpha-2 language code * [[Minimum inhibitory concentration]], in microbiology, the lowest concentration of an antimicrobial that will inhibit growth of a microorganism == Technology == * [[Mandatory Integrity Control]], a new security feature in Microsoft Windows Vista * [[Intel MIC]] (Many Integrated Core), Intel's many-core processor architecture * [[Message Integrity Code]], a cryptographic checksum used in wireless communications * Mic., abbreviation for [[micrometer]], a measuring tool * Mic., abbreviation for [[microphone]] * [[Microsoft Innovation Center]] {{disambiguation}}
